PSSI Akhiri Kerja Sama dengan Pelatih Timnas Indonesia Simon McMenemy
06 Nov 2019, 08:48 by Miradin Syahbana Rizky
JAKARTA, (PR).- Ketua Umum PSSI Pusat M Iriawan memenuhi janjinya untuk mencari pelatih anyar untuk timnas Indonesia. Â Pasalnya, melalui Instagram resmi PSSI di @officialpssi, mereka mengakhiri kerja samadengan pelatih Simon McMenemy pada Rabu, 6 November 2019.
Dalam pernyataanya, federasi mengatakan laga melawan Malaysia di matchday kelima Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 Zona Asia, 19 November 2019, menjadi momen terakhir Simon membesut skuat Garuda. Dengan begitu, keberadaan Simon di timnas Indonesia terbilang singkat.
"PSSI secara resmi berpisah dengan Simon McMenemy. Simon akan menjalani laga terakhir kontra Malaysia pada 19 November mendatang di Kuala Lumpur. Terima kasih, Coach Simon!" tulis PSSI.
Simon sedianya baru ditunjuk menjadi pelatih pada awal 2019. Ia menjadi suksesor Luis Milla dan Bima Sakti, yang sebelumnya gagal membawa prestasi di SEA Games dan Piala AFF 2018.
Posisi Simon mulai disorot menyusul performa buruk Timnas Indonesia di Kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 Zona Asia. Dari empat laga yang sudah dijalani, Evan Dimas dkk selalu menelan kalah.
Sebelum dipecat, sebenarnya Simon mampu melakukan debut gemilang bersama timnas. Di laga uji coba internasional, Simon memetik hasil positif dengan mengalahkan Myanmar 2-0, Maret 2019.
Akan tetapi, pada laga persahabatan berikutnya pertengahan Juni, Garuda mengalami kekalahan 1-4 dari Yordania. Skuat besutan Simon kembali meraih kemenangan pada laga uji coba internasional atas Vanuatu dengan skor telak 6-0.
Simon kemudian mendapat sorotan negatif setelah memimpin skuatnya di turnamen internasional, kualifikasi Piala Dunia 2022 zona Asia. Pada laga perdana di Stadion Utama Gelora Bung Karno (GBK), Indonesia dipermalukan Malaysia dengan skor 2-3. Merah Putih kian meradang setelah dikalahkan Thailand 0-3 di GBK.
Indonesia semakin terpuruk ketika dikalahkan tuan rumah Uni Emirat Arab 0-5. Merah Putih juga takluk dari Vietnam 1-3. Total empat kali kekalahan secara beruntun di kualifikasi Piala Dunia zona Asia membuat dia terlempar dari kursi pelatih.
Prestasi Simon menangani Indonesia juga berbanding terbalik ketika dia masih melatih timnas Filipina. Saat itu dia mampu membawa The Azkals ke semifinal Piala AFF 2010 untuk kali pertama dalam sejarah skuat tersebut.
Filipina gagal melangkah ke final setelah kalah agregat 0-2 dari Indonesia. Laga itu pula yang membuat Simon sempat menyatakan tertarik menangani Indonesia.***

PSSI End the Cooperation with the Indonesian National Team Coach Simon McMenemy
Nov 6 2019, 08:48 by Miradin Syahbana Rizky
JAKARTA, (PR) .- Chairman of the Central PSSI M Iriawan fulfilled his promise to find a brand-new coach for the Indonesian national team. The reason is, through PSSI's official Instagram at @officialpssi, they ended cooperation with coach Simon McMenemy on Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
In its statement, the federation said the match against Malaysia on the fifth matchday of the 2022 Asian Zone World Cup Qualifiers, November 19, 2019, was the last moment that Simon made Garuda's squad. That way, Simon's presence in the Indonesian national team is fairly short.
"PSSI officially parted ways with Simon McMenemy. Simon will have his last match against Malaysia on November 19 in Kuala Lumpur. Thank you, Coach Simon!" write PSSI.
Simon was originally appointed to be a coach at the start of 2019. He became a successor to Luis Milla and the Milky Way, who had previously failed to bring achievements at the 2018 SEA Games and AFF Cup.
Simon's position began to be highlighted following the poor performance of the Indonesian national team in the 2022 World Cup Qualification Asian Zone. Of the four matches that have been undertaken, Evan Dimas et al always swallow defeat.
Before being fired, Simon was actually able to make a glorious debut with the national team. In the international test match, Simon reap positive results by beating Myanmar 2-0, March 2019.
However, in the next friendly match mid-June, Garuda suffered a 1-4 defeat to Jordan. Simon's squad won again in the international trial match against Vanuatu with a landslide score of 6-0.
Simon then received a negative spotlight after leading his squad at the international tournament, the 2022 World Cup qualifying zone in Asia. In the inaugural match at the Bung Karno Main Stadium (GBK), Indonesia humiliated Malaysia with a score of 2-3. Red and White increasingly inflamed after being defeated Thailand 0-3 in GBK.
Indonesia got worse when it was defeated by the host of United Arab Emirates 0-5. Merah Putih is also subdued from Vietnam 1-3. A total of four consecutive defeats in the Asian zone World Cup qualifiers knocked him out of the coach's seat.
Simon's achievements in handling Indonesia were also inversely proportional to when he was still training the Philippine national team. At that time he was able to bring the Azkals to the 2010 AFF Cup semifinals for the first time in the history of the squad.
The Philippines failed to reach the final after losing 0-2 on aggregate to Indonesia. That match also made Simon say he was interested in handling Indonesia. ***
